definition: good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: Bungy and I had had an ambivalent relationship over years.
sentences.chinese: 我和邦迪多年來有着好惡參半的關係。

sentences.english: In doing translation, one should not alter the meaning of the original to suit one's own taste.
sentences.chinese: 翻譯時不應根據自己的好惡改變原文的意思。

sentences.english: The two sisters share the same likes and dislikes.
sentences.chinese: 這兩姐妹有相同的好惡愛憎。

sentences.english: We clearly have similar interests and likes.
sentences.chinese: 我們很明顯的有着相似的興趣和好惡。

sentences.english: Excellences do not depend on a single man's pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 某人某物是否優異不取決於一人的好惡。

sentences.english: Share what you are experiencing in terms of flavours and textures, likes and dislikes.
sentences.chinese: 分享你體驗過的口味和材質，你的好惡。

sentences.english: A leader should adhere to the principle of justice, and can not act according to his own preference.
sentences.chinese: 做領導就要秉持公心，不能以個人好惡行事。
討厭，那魚聞起來好惡心。

sentences.english: Bungy and I had an ambivalent relationship over years.
sentences.chinese: 我和邦迪多年來有着好惡參半的關係。

sentences.english: Excellences do not depend on a single person's pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 某人某物優異與否並不取決於某一個人的好惡。

sentences.english: Focus on the emotions, not the words, and stay calm.
sentences.chinese: 關注情感，而不在於言辭好惡，然後保持心態平衡。

definition: the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to harm others/to mock people/to taunt/humiliating
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to be disappointing/to fail to live up to expectations
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
